Class ReadoutClampedFB

  • java.lang.Object
    • Readout
      • ReadoutClampedFB
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streams.Feedback

    public class ReadoutClampedFB
extends Readout
    Readout units with clamped feedback. The readout is the actual readout using the random weights. The feedback, however, is computed using a target readout via a Streams.InputStream object. The target readout can be gotten by a different method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReadoutClampedFB

        public ReadoutClampedFB(Streams.InputStream target,
                int N,
                double p,
                double p_z,
                double g)
        Initialize a feedback/readout set of M neurons that feed back on N network units. M is given by the size of the target stream.
        Parameters:
        target - the target readout
        N - the number of feedbacks
        p - the probability of a feedback connection (sparsity parameter)
        p - the probability of a readout connection (sparsity parameter)
        g - weighting factor for gaussian FEEDBACK connectivity (output scaled to 1)

      • ReadoutClampedFB

        public ReadoutClampedFB(Streams.InputStream target,
                int N)
        Initialize a network with default parameters.

      • getReadoutAndFeedback

        public DoubleMatrix getReadoutAndFeedback(DoubleMatrix r,
                                 double t,
                                 DoubleMatrix readout,
                                 DoubleMatrix feedback)
        Get the readout and feedback, given the current state of the network. Here, the readout is the real readout, but the feedback is computed using the TARGET readout.
        Overrides:
        getReadoutAndFeedback in class Readout
        Parameters:
        r - the network state
        t - the current time
        readout - the readout
        feedback - the feedback
